sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Handwritten picture postcard from Hans Liebstoeckl to Schenker, dated January 11, 1928
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: Without naming the composer or title, Liebstöckl expresses himself in disparaging terms about Ernst Krenek and the latter's opera, Jonny spielt auf.
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: Mist; shit; Altersschwäche; decrepitude

tei:fw.tei:note: picture top-left, with caption: Traunkirchen, Oberösterr.

tei:address.tei:addrLine: An: Dr. Heinrich Maria(?)"(?)" overwritten on "Maria", presumably by Schenker. Perhaps Liebstöckl intended it to be a joke. Schenker

tei:opener.tei:salute: Verehrtester Freund!Receipt of this letter is recorded in Schenker's diary at OJ 4/1, p. 3165, January 12, 1928: "Von Liebstöckl (K.): drückt mir die Hand für meine Zuschrift u. ruft aus: „... dieser Satz, diese Bässe“! (bei Křenek)." ("From Liebstöckl (postcard): shakes my hand for my response, and cries: "… this counterpoint, these bass lines"! (in Křenek's music)."). The communication to which this is a response is not known to survive.

tei:div.tei:p: Ich drücke Ihnen die Hand. Was sagen Sie zu Graf? Zu Kralik? Zu Bienenfeld? Zu Decsey?The allusion is to the first performance of Ernst Krenek's Jonny spielt auf at the Vienna State Opera on December 31, 1927. Graf declared himself very fond of the opera (Der Tag, January 1, 1928, pp. 11–12). Heinrich Kralik expressed himself in postive terms, albeit not uncritically (Neues Wiener Tagblatt, January 1, 1928, pp. 2–3). Elsa Bienenfeld published an ambivalent short review (Neues Wiener Journal, January 6, 1928, p. 18). A corresponding review by Ernst Decsey could not be traced. Wie die Arbeit, so die Universaledition!Krenek's opera Jonny spielt auf was published by Universal Edition, Schenker's principal publisher. "Wie die Arbeit, so der Lohn" is a German proverb meaning "When the work is not good, the pay is small." The implication here is: "This (wretched) composition says much about the deplorable condition of Universal Edition." Der Kompomist"Kompomist": a play on words between Mist = "shit" and Komponist = "composer." unserer Tage! Dieser Satz, diese Bässe, diese Deklamation, diese Altersschwäche in der Jugend! Coëo, ergo sum!"Coëo, ergo sum": the original dictum of Descartes reads "Cogito ergo sum" – "I think, therefore I am." Liebstoeckl adapts this as "I copulate, therefore I am."

tei:fw.tei:note: picture top-left, with caption: Traunkirchen, Upper Austria

tei:div.tei:p: I press your hand. What do you say to Graf? To Kralik? To Bienenfeld? To Decsey? As with the work, so with Universal Edition! The composer of our time! This counterpoint, these bass lines, this declamation, this decrepitude of youth! Coëo, ergo sum!
